#import library
import numpy as np
import pandas as pd
import seaborn as sns
import matplotlib.pyplot as plt
from sklearn.model_selection import train_test_split
from sklearn.linear_model import LinearRegression
from sklearn import metrics
source.8507294f:
#transform data
covid['active'] = covid['active'].astype('int')
covid['confirmed'] = covid['confirmed'].astype('int')
covid['deaths'] = covid['deaths'].astype('int')
covid['recovered'] = covid['recovered'].astype('int')
covid.head()
source.c557a438:
#heatmap correlation
plt.figure(figsize = (10,6))
sns.heatmap(covid.corr(), annot = True, square = True)
plt.title("Pearson Correlation")
plt.show()
source.d5c0aa77:
#handling categorical data
df = pd.get_dummies(covid, drop_first = True)
df.head()
source.583514ff:
#split data
X = df.drop('active', axis = 1)
y = df['active']
X_train, X_test, y_train, y_test = train_test_split(X, y, test_size = 0.3, random_state = 0)
print(X_train.shape)
print(y_train.shape)
print(X_test.shape)
print(y_test.shape)
source.593538da:
#Linear Regression
lr = LinearRegression()
%time lr.fit(X_train, y_train)
lr.score(X_test, y_test)
source.51d0dbda:
#check MAE, MSE & RMSE
print('Mean Absolute Error : ', metrics.mean_absolute_error(y_test, y_pred).round(2))
print('Mean Squared Error : ', metrics.mean_squared_error(y_test, y_pred).round(2))
print('Root Mean Squared Error : ', np.sqrt(metrics.mean_absolute_error(y_test, y_pred).round(2)))
source.3ab41d9d:
#defining feature
coef = pd.Series(lr.coef_, index = X.columns)

imp_coef = pd.concat([coef.sort_values().head(10),
                     coef.sort_values().tail(10)])
source.f81492b3:
#visualize feature
plt.figure(figsize = (10,6))
imp_coef.plot(kind = 'barh', color = 'salmon')
plt.title("Feature Importance")
plt.xlabel('Score')
plt.ylabel('Features')
plt.show()

plt.figure(figsize = (10,6))
sns.countplot(covid['continent'], palette = 'Set1')
plt.title("Continent")
plt.show()
